subject: Business
title: The Latte Factor: Small Spending Adds Up
description: A 60-second lesson on The Latte Factor: Small Spending Adds Up.

hook.text: A $5 daily latte is $1,825/year. Invested over 30 years at 10%, that becomes $330,000.

buildup.text: David Bach coined the Latte Factor: small daily costs compound into huge lost wealth over decades.

discovery.text: It applies to any recurring small cost: subscriptions, snacks, impulse buys.

twist.text: Critics say cutting lattes is joyless. Real gains come from big wins like salary and housing costs.

climax.text: The truth: both matter. Small leaks sink ships, but you also need a ship worth sailing.

punchline.text: Watch the small expenses. They compound too.

quiz.question: What is the Latte Factor?
options: Small daily expenses compound into large lost wealth over decades
